instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01700: What is 820-01700? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.3V3_G3H_RTC: What is 3V3_G3H_RTC? 3V3_G3H_RTC Is an abbreviation of PP3V3_G3H_RTC which is one of the first rails that has to come on in order for the USB-C mux chip to be powered in the T2 chip Macbook Pros..
definitions.R7020: What is R7020? Current sense shunt resistor for the charger, the resistors between this and the ISL6259 should be proper rating or else machine will turn off the charger. Measuring pins 27/28 on ISL6259 should give you 20.02 ohms. .
definitions.3V3_G3H: What is 3V3_G3H? This is one of the first power rails that must turn on for Macbooks that use USB-C for charging. This power rail powers the CD3215 chip that controls the USB-C charger, speaks to the USB-C charger, and requests 20 volts up from the default 5 volts that the USB-C charger puts out when initially connected to an unknown device. .
definitions.A2141: What is A2141? A2141 is a model number for a 16 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years 2019 with EMC 3347, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-01700..
definitions.ISL9240: What is ISL9240? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2018 through 2020.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message:
got very slight corrosion on some caps  (ssd area) but nothing serious (no shorted found)
all coils related to ssd are good nothing shorted.
all other bigcoils not including cpu area is good aswell.
unable to boot on dfu mode.

all usb c ports got same behaviour 5.19v-.22amp freeze. using orig 87w charger

<CHIP>U6960</CHIP>  VIN 0.6V and EN 0V not shorted
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  0.6v 0.216ohms
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_G3H_RTC_REG_R</SIGNAL> 0.1v 0.415ohms

tried my luck by replacing <CHIP>U6960</CHIP> and <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> nothing changes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message:
"using orig 87w charger"
This machine requires 96W charger!

Why did you touch <CHIP>U6960</CHIP>?
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> MUST appear before <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H_RTC</SIGNAL>.
Do you get 5V at <RESISTOR>R7020</RESISTOR>?
Check <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> basic voltages.

threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 95425, member: 682"]
96/140W charger?
[/QUOTE]
is this really required? i fixed alot of a2141s using my 87w charger with no issues.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message: this can be <CHIP>U7800</CHIP> by not getting ppbus and <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message:
<MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A2141</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> turns on with 87W, if battery still holds some charge.
Get correct adapter first.

<CHIP>U7800</CHIP> can't work before <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is generated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message:
update:
injecting v on ppbus found leak on CA780 (<SIGNAL>PPBUS_HS_GPU</SIGNAL>)
after i removed ca780 now ppbus is 5.2V still no voltage on <SIGNAL>3V3_G3H</SIGNAL> area
also still not turning into dfu mode.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01700</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no power 5V 0.22amp no dfu SOLVED
threads.message:
[QUOTE="2informaticos, post: 95526, member: 682"]
Check <TRANSISTOR>Q7030</TRANSISTOR>/40...
[/QUOTE]
your right, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> pin1 <SIGNAL>CHGR_GATE_Q4</SIGNAL> is not connected properly from <CHIP>ISL9240</CHIP>
now im getting 20v on my charger and ppbus is 12.6V
